subject: Self Care
title: Digital Minimalism
description: A micro-lesson that makes Digital Minimalism usable.

hook.text: He quit all social media, kept only essential tools, and reported more free time, focus, and satisfaction than ever.

buildup.text: Digital minimalism, coined by Cal Newport, means using technology only when it clearly supports your values and goals.

discovery.text: The philosophy: start from zero digital tools. Add back only what provides clear, irreplaceable value to your life.

twist.text: Most people add tools endlessly. Minimalism reverses the default: nothing is allowed unless it proves its worth first.

climax.text: For 30 days, strip to essentials. Then add tools back one by one. Keep only what genuinely serves your chosen life.

punchline.text: Use tech that serves you. Delete what just entertains you.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of digital minimalism?
options: Use as many tools as possible
Only use technology that clearly supports your values and goals
